content.user_title: Analyze codebases with structured technical overview
content.value_statement: Developers often struggle to understand unfamiliar codebases quickly. This skill provides a systematic framework for analyzing project structure, components, dependencies, and architecture to deliver comprehensive technical documentation on demand.
actual_capabilities: Scan repository structure and identify entry points and configuration files
Analyze main components, modules, and their responsibilities
Map dependencies between components and external libraries
Trace execution flow from startup through request handling
Document deployment architecture and containerization details
Describe runtime behavior including error handling and background tasks
limitations: Does not modify code or suggest implementations
Does not perform security audits or vulnerability assessments
Analysis depth depends on codebase size and complexity
Does not generate code or refactoring suggestions

use_cases.title: Onboard to codebase
use_cases.description: Help new team members understand project structure and architecture quickly.

use_cases.title: Create documentation
use_cases.description: Generate technical documentation for systems that lack up-to-date docs.

use_cases.title: Assess system design
use_cases.description: Get comprehensive overviews of system components and their interactions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain this codebase structure including main directories, entry points, and key configuration files.

prompt_templates.title: Component deep dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe the major components in this codebase, their responsibilities, and how they interact with each other.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the deployment architecture including build steps, dependencies, and containerization details.

prompt_templates.title: Full analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a comprehensive technical overview including repository structure, core components, component interactions, deployment architecture, and runtime behavior.

output: Repository Structure: Main directories include src/, config/, tests/. Entry points are index.js and app.js.
Core Components: API handler module, database connector, authentication service, utility library.
Dependencies: Express, PostgreSQL driver, Jest testing framework.
Deployment: Docker-based containerization, environment variables for configuration.

best_practices: Start with repository structure before diving into component details
Identify key configuration files early to understand project setup
Follow the execution flow from startup to request handling
Document component interactions and data flow patterns
anti_patterns: Avoid including personal opinions about code quality
Do not suggest implementations unless specifically requested
Do not skip dependency mapping as it reveals architecture patterns
Avoid generic descriptions - be specific about component responsibilities

faq.question: What does this skill analyze?
faq.answer: It analyzes repository structure, main components, dependencies, interactions, deployment setup, and runtime behavior.

faq.question: Is this suitable for large codebases?
faq.answer: It works for codebases of any size but may need multiple focused prompts for very large projects.

faq.question: Does it generate documentation files?
faq.answer: No, it provides analysis and descriptions. You would need to document the output yourself.

faq.question: Can it analyze code in any language?
faq.answer: Yes, the framework is language-agnostic and works for any programming language.

faq.question: Does it perform security analysis?
faq.answer: No, this is a technical overview skill, not a security audit tool.

faq.question: How detailed is the output?
faq.answer: Output detail depends on the specificity of your prompt and codebase complexity.
